events.1691: Job Charnock established the first English factory in Calcutta.
events.1803: Jagannath Sunkerseth, great social worker, education lover and one of the sculptors of modern Mumbai, was born.
events.1806: Father Kuriakose Elias Chavara, freedom fighter and social reformer, was born at Kainakary , Kerala.
events.1846: British forces under Hugh Gough defeated Sikhs in the Battle of Sobrahan in India.
events.1859: General Horsford defeats Begum of Oude & Nana Sahib in Indian mutiny.
events.1897: Sannidhanam Suryanarayana Sastry, educationist and writer, was born at Chiriwada, (A.P).
events.1902: Hemraj, politician, was born at Dera Gopipur, (H.P.).
events.1910: Smt. Durga Bhagwat, veteran Marathi writer, was born.
events.1921: Wilhelm Conrad Von Roentgen, professor and nobel prize winner, passed away.
events.1926: Rajmata Krishna Kumari, social worker, was born at Dharangadhra.
events.1927: Dashrathi (Dashrathi Krishnamacharya), famous Telgu poet, was born.
events.1930: Shrikant Kirloskar, director of 'Kirloskar Udyog Samuh', was born.
events.1931: Capital of India shifted from Old Delhi to New Delhi, formal inauguration of New Delhi City took place.
events.1943: Gandhi begins hunger strike to protest imprisonment. This strike lasted for 21 days till March 3.
events.1944: Japanese troops take the Ngakyedauk Pass, cutting off the 7th Indian Division at Sinzweya, Burma.
events.1946: Gandhiji revives 'Harijan' and allied group of weekly journals.
events.1957: Pranab Pankaj Roy, cricketer (son of Pankaj, Indian batsman 1982), was born in Calcutta.
events.1961: P. L. Deshpande played first solo drama 'Batatyachi Chawl'.
events.1979: Itanagar was declared as capital of Arunachal Pradesh.
events.1982: K. R. Meher-Homji, cricket wicket keeper (one Test, one catch, no stumps), passed away.
events.1986: Pope John Paul II ends visit to India.
events.1990: Saroj Mukherjee, WB's CPI(M) secretary, died.
events.1992: Andaman and Nicobar Islands opened for foreign travellers.
events.1995: PM appoints Madhavrao Scindia as Human Resource Minister, Pranab Mukherjee as External Minister, Buta Singh as Civil Supplies, Ajit Singh as Food, and P. Chidambaram as Commerce Minister.
events.1999: P. Gopi Chand (A.P.) and Aparna Popat (Karnataka) won the men's and women's singles titles respectively in the National badminton championship in Delhi.
